channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2024030594
item.description:
Report E-2024030594

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: (1) a 330 Gallon plastic IBC tote was punctured in the front during loading operations. No Drains, soils or waterways were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024030593
item.description:
Report E-2024030593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-23
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Approximately 150 gallons of "Quali Pro 3D Herbicide" from one unknown-sized poly tote which had been punctured near the bottom by a rivet during loading. No Drains, Soils, or waterways were reported impacted.

item.title: Report E-2024030609
item.description:
Report E-2024030609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-01T03:13:04+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-02
  • City: BIRMINGHAM
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: KAG LEASING, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 615000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: The KAG Energy, LLC unit was traveling on I 59 near Birmingham, AL. The driver lost control of the unit and went off the roadway and rolled over. The trailer was compromised and approximately 6000 gallons of gasoline was released. Hepaco Environmental responded to the scene and handled the remediation.
